                 Founder.org applications are accepted until April 30th. Apply here !            2013 Competition finalist, Keen Home Scored One of the Biggest Wins in 'Shark Tank' History.            The Berkley Center and the Office of Student Engagement kicked off the 2015 Langone Speaker Series with Devon Pike of Givenchy.            Semi-finalists, including students, alumni, faculty & researchers, across 12 NYU schools participated in the 13th Annual Venture Showcase.            Don't miss the Final Round of the $200K Entrepreneurs Challenge. Join us May 1. Register to attend here .                In a business world of non-stop change, there's only one way to win the game: Transform it entirely.    Our mission: To develop serial innovators capable of launching and leading organizations that challenge assumed boundaries and inspire a sense of what's possible.        – A Catalyst for New Venture Creation          At the Berkley Center, we provide students with real-world, hands-on startup experiences that complement the rigorous instruction received in the classroom. And we offer alumni, faculty and staff a platform from which they can leverage their professional experience and skills to launch new ventures or accelerate the growth of existing ones.    Each year, more than 800 aspiring entrepreneurs and early-stage CEOs turn to the Berkley Center for information, guidance and startup assistance. Take a moment to explore what NYU Stern and the Berkley Center for Entrepreneurship and Innovation have to offer you, an entrepreneurial leader of tomorrow.                         Popular Links       $200K Entrepreneurs Challenge    New Venture Office Hours & Startup Services    Volunteer    Ideas Never Sleep      Congratulations! $200K Entrepreneurs Challenge   2014-2015 Semi-finalist Teams          Get your idea rolling .   Schedule a meeting with us!    For more information, visit Startup Services .          Contact the Berkley Center   Henry Kaufman Management Center  Suite 8-160  44 West 4th St.  New York, NY 10012  Phone: 212-998-0070                   Upcoming    $200K Entrepreneurs Challenge Final Pitches and Awards Celebration, May 1.  And the winner is .....  249 ventures entered. 14 finalists remain.   Who will go on to share more than $200,000 in prize money and services remains to be seen. Teams will also be competing for the Audience Choice Award. Vote for your favorite team.   RSVP   Founder.org Applications  Annually 50 student teams are admitted into the Founder.org program to gain valuable insight to build a great company.  Applications are accepted until April 30th. Apply here .   Grand Central Tech  GCT's goal is provide the best startups with the best resources at unbeatable terms. Accepted companies receive a full year of free office space, access to interns, mentors, legal/tax/PR/accounting services, in house recruiters, a global network of investors, and access to corporate partners.  Applications due May 1 - Apply here .      In the Spotlight   Keen Home 2013 New Venture Competition Finalist team secures the funding they were seeking from Robert Herjavec on "Shark Tank". Excerpt taken from Inc.com -- "Keen Home, a former finalist in Inc.'s Coolest College Startups, landed one of the highest valuations in the history of 'Shark Tank'." Senior Seminar: Le roman de l’entre-deux-guerres    |     French    | New York University                                   Skip to page Content.     NEW YORK UNIVERSITY     ARTS AND SCIENCE     COLLEGE OF ARTS AND SCIENCE     GRADUATE SCHOOL OF ARTS AND SCIENCE                                Home       About Us       People       Undergraduate Program       Graduate program       Events       Employment             Stay Connected           Facebook             Affiliations         Center for French Civilization and Culture           La Maison Francaise           Institute of French Studies           NYU Paris                    Back to Home       Senior Seminar: Le roman de l’entre-deux-guerres                                    Claudie Bernard          19 University Place, room 634      E-mail: cb1@nyu.edu                         SENIOR SEMINAR      Le roman de l’entre-deux-guerres      FREN-UA 991.001                  Course in French      Monday and Wednesday 3:30-4:45      Fall 2012           After WWI, the French novel is faced with new challenges. We  will examine three aspects of its rich production: the psychological  exploration, equipped with new analytical tools; the depiction of a society  deeply affected by the recent historical upheavals and ideological debates; and  the experimentation with new non-realistic approaches and forms.           The course requires active participation in class  discussion, several oral presentations, two 10 page papers, and a final exam.                Texts             François Mauriac,   Le Baiser au lépreux (1922)      Julien Green, Adrienne Mesurat (1927)      Henri Barbusse, Le Feu (1917)      Louis-Ferdinand  Céline, Mort à crédit (1936)      Jean Cocteau, Thomas l’imposteur (1923)      Jules  Supervielle, Le Voleur d’enfants (1926)      Raymond Queneau, Le Chiendent (1933)                            NYU Department of French                              19 University Place, 6th Floor                        New York, NY 10003                 Contact Us | © New York University , Arts and Science
